skills.name: Calculate the area of a rectangle where the dimensions are given in the same units

explanations.A: I think you've added the measurements. But, to calculate the area of a rectangle, multiply the length by the width and remember to give the answer in square units.
explanations.B: I think you've added the measurements. But, to calculate the area of a rectangle, multiply the length by the width. Well done for remembering that the area will be measured in square units.
explanations.C: You've correctly multiplied the length by the width to get the area of the rectangle but remember to give the answer in square units.
explanations.D: To calculate the area of a rectangle, multiply the length by the width and give the answer in square units. 7 x 5 = 35, so the area is 35 square units.

explanations.A: You've correctly multiplied the length by the width to get the area of the rectangle, but what should the units be, if we have multiplied units by units?
explanations.B: To calculate the area of a rectangle, multiply the length by the width and give the answer in square units. 4 x 6 = 24, so the area is 24 square units.

explanations.A: All the sides of a square are the same length. So,to calculate the area of a square, multiply a side length by itself. 6 x 6 = 36. The side length was given in meters so the area will be given in square meters: 36 square meters.
explanations.B: I think you've added the measurements. But, to calculate the area of a square, multiply a side length by itself. Also, remember to give the answer in square meters.
